related_post.text: > Okay my commit history is so messed up I keep trying to squash these but it will just create a seperate commit with again.. how can I squash these commits into one... I try `git rebase i HEAD~10` but it brings me in a menu and wants me to select some commits? I'm so confused@Theagainmen that prompt allows you to select what things should be done for each commit stuff like rewording the commit message or editing the commit itself

so_post.text: @PureFunctor here it says that this should squash it: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5189560/squashmylastxcommitstogetherusinggit however I have no clue what to do in this menu. I just want to squash my latest pushed commits into 1.

comments: Jacopo has issue with commits and Jaquarias provides a direct SO answer
